question: 聴く
sourceAnswer: to{} hear | listen-(e.g.-to-music) | ask/enquire/query | hear-about/hear-of/learn-of | follow-(advice,-order,-etc.)/obey/listen-to/comply-with | hear-(e.g.-a-plea)/grant-(a-request)/accept-(e.g.-an-argument)/give-consideration-to | smell-(esp.-incense)/sample-(a-fragrance) | taste-(alcohol)/try
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>listen</kanji> and the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to listen to</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to hear</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The meaning is really similar to <ja>聞く</ja>, right? The reading is the same.
